t: Job 21
But*p Job answered and said,
Hear*p diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
Suffer*p me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.
As*p for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
Mark*p me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.
Even*p when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
Wherefore*p do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
Their*p seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
Their*p houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.
Their*p bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
They*p send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
They*p take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
They*p spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.
Therefore*p they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
What*p is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
Lo,*p their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
How*p oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.
They*p are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
God*p layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
His*p eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
For*p what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
Shall*p any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.
One*p dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
His*p breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
And*p another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
They*p shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
Behold,*p I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
For*p ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?
Have*p ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,
That*p the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
Who*p shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?
Yet*p shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.
The*p clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
How*p then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
